questions.question: The increased food production accompanying the introduction of Champa rice into China from Vietnam during the eleventh century best illustrates which of the following?
answers: The reliance of China on food imports
The importance of Vietnam to the world economy
The stimulation of agriculture by technological innovation
The influence of China on neighboring societies
questions.explanation: The introduction of Champa rice into China during the eleventh century led to a population increase in China. This population increase was due to the fact that Champa rice was drought resistant and could be harvested twice a year. This led to a population increase in China, which in turn led to a greater demand for food. This demand for food led to the stimulation of agriculture by technological innovation.
